Description: Small brown pottery juglet with drop-shaped body, possible imitation of the Cypriot Black-on-Red ware; short neck with neck-ridge, probably flaring to a funnel-shaped mouth (now damaged); thick handle from shoulder to neck-ridge; red clay and fugitive buff-coloured slip, decorated in black paint: three narrow lines at lower part of shoulder.
Curator's comments: The vase is possibly a local imitation of the Cypriot Black-on-Red juglets with neck-ridge and funnel-shaped mouth; the usual disc-base of the Cypriot originals has been replaced with a rounded base, following local pottery taste. Compare E. Gjerstad, The Swedish Cyprus Expedition Vol. IV, Part 2 (Stockholm 1948), pl. XXV.9.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (HB.08)
